subject: Re: [junit] Avoid System.out
msgSnippet: ... Well, one way is to use assertEquals, which will display the values expected and obtained. You can always write code like: if (badThingHappens) fail(
messageBody:
On Thursday 10 March 2005 21:25, bkkunam wrote:
> Hi,
> When we run Junit test cases, I want to see the output values on
> the screen if the test fails. Currently we are using
> System.out.println (variable) to see the value of the variable. Is
> there any other way to see the values without using
> System.out.println function. Appreciate your
> help. Please respond.

Well, one way is to use assertEquals, which will display the
values expected and obtained.

You can always write code like:

if (badThingHappens) fail( "message " + theBadValue(s) );

and then when you've written it for the umpetey-third [1] time,
abstract that into your own assert method. (EG the test code for
Jena models/graphs defines an assertIsoGraphs(G1,G2) method which,
if G1 isn't isomorphic to G2, fails with a dump of the graph contents
that tries to be helpfully legible.)


--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
